On Dec 16, 2011, at 9:54 PM, Mike Kelly wrote:

> What is the systemic ben=
efit to the web of having PUT defined further
> than just 'a non-safe idemp=
otent update'?

To me, HTTP defines PUT just like that. The rest of the spe=
c for PUT is explanatory, e.g. regarding cache behavior or clarifying that =
PUT on an non-existing resource is a create (and hence should yield a 201 r=
esponse).

So again, what specifically does feel like 'baggage' to you in H=
TTP1.1 section 9.6?

Jan
